data.title: Mingw-w64 Build fails @ compiling Urho2DLuaAPI.cpp
data.body: In the PhysicsWorld2D.pkg file, the reference operator on Vector2D& GetGravity() causes a compilation error on Mingw: "error: taking address of temporary". Removing the reference operators solves the issue.

data.title: More example and base models
data.body:
Box renamed to Cube.
Monkey, TeaPot and Torus added.

data.title: Layer Masks don't work for GetRigidBodies
data.body: Attempting to use collision layers and collision masks for GetRigidBodies, or at least the sphere and box test varieties. The test simply returns all colliding rigidbodies regardless of the collision mask passed in as a parameter and the layers of the rigidbodies. Manually checking the mask and each rigidbody's layer in turn leads me to believe this is an internal problem, as my layers and collision mask seem to be interacting correctly in the check.

data.title: Attribute Inspector is not at window right edge at editor startup
data.body: Presumably when the Editor window maximizes itself at startup, there happens an intermediate state when the window width is still 1024, and that is used for initializing the UI, including the attribute inspector's position.

data.title: ForEach Implementation Error
data.body:
Can't give much information about the error, it was occurring on a Travis build for my Spline Refactor Pull Request:

(https://travis-ci.org/urho3d/Urho3D/jobs/20394132)

The code causing the issue is:

```
    foreach(SharedPtr<Node> child, node_->GetChildren())
        child->AddListener(this);
```

Compiles fine in VS2013 (which really isn't saying much is it.) Is the ForEach loop limited for use on certain compilers?

data.title: Spline Refactor
data.body:
Refactor the Spline class into two parts SplinePath and Spline.
### Spline

This is the mathematical functionality separated out that provides Bezier Curve (for now, working on Catmul Rom) Interpolation for float, Vector[2,3,4] and Color. It provides functionality for:
- Management of Knots (Control Points).
- Getting a position along the Spline from 0.0f - 1.0f.
- Management of Interpolation Mode.

Note Linear Interpolation is provided by using only two Knots or Control points in Bezier Curve Interpolation Mode.
### SplinePath

This is the Component part that provides functionality to move a specific Node along a path defined by Interpolating over a set of Control Points defined by the specified Nodes, it provides the functionality for:
- Moving the Controlled Node along the Spline based on Speed.
- Setting the Controlled Node's position along the Spline.
- Debug Rendering.
- Setting the Interpolation Mode.
- Getting a Point from the Spline from 0.0f - 1.0f.
- Management of Control Points based on Nodes.

This is a Vector3 implementation.

Debug Rendering Example
![Debug Rendering](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/30584379/Urho/splinepath-debug.png)

fixes #229

data.title: Shadows crash on Android
data.body:
When switching between scenes on Android, I have to disable shadows to prevent from crash.

Steps to reproduce:
- take Aster's sample at https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/56770481/SwitchScene.lua
- modify to make lights, boxes and mushrooms cast shadows
- switch back and forth between the scenes to reproduce the crash

This issue seems to be related to the mods done for "inView", as it previously didn't crash.

data.title: Set editor script to windowed/scalable by default if no parameters specified
data.body: Its kind of opinionated but if a new comer doesn't know about the command line args or if you are launching via double click or something you get fullscreen when you probably want windowed with re-sizable.  I don't like adding the extra wierdness to the script which may confuse people.  I think this might be the lesser of 2 evils.  Like all my ideas don't feel afraid to shoot em down!

data.title: No editor interface for screensize setting or toggling fullscreen
data.body: The editor doesn't have a ui to set the screen size or the resolution.

data.title: Possible bug in animation interpolation between last and first frame
data.body:
I have a model with perfect loopable animation and I can see snap in urho when animation starts again in looped mode. I exported model from blender by urho-blender exporter but it also happens when exporting with collada.

Here you can find model and animations. The Animation 0 is just one loop and snap occurs once per walk cycle. Second is animation with doubled walk cycle and the snap occurs once per 2 walk cycles. So it is clear that something bad happens when repeating the animation(or something with exporting last or first frame). Set animation speed to very low and look at the legs.

https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B-FH5cooowQpYkJodFJsdzlnNkU&usp=sharing

data.title: What about using Mono for scripting?
data.body: Did you ever think about using Mono for scripting purpose, I know AngelScript and Lua is ok, but C# scripting will provide huge feature set, now an issue but just want to know what you think about?

data.title: Units per pixel in 2D components is misleading
data.body:
In the Sprite2D component, units per pixel actually means pixels per unit (increasing it decreases sprite size) while in ParticleEmitter2D increasing it makes the effect even bigger.

I propose to fix this by renaming it PixelsPerUnit in the Drawable2D base class and making the behavior consistent. I can do this before the release.

data.title: dose the editor can edit the spline
data.body:
Hi, all
I don't know how to use the spline in editor, I create a node and a spline component, and set 4 control points, but the editor can't draw a Bezier Curve, would you tell me how to do this? And is there exist a sample project? Anyway, dose the editor can edit the spline by moving the control point among the scene?
Thank you for your answers!

data.title: Stripping lib prefix from Mingw builds.
data.body: A recent commit has started stripping the lib prefix from static library builds. Is this the desired behavior? I build a custom executable external to the Urho3D build framework (a project in Code::Blocks) and it needs to have the prefix in order to find the library, forcing me to rename it after a new build. I hate the idea of the manual renaming, since I just know I'm going to forget it one of these days and end up linking against an older version.
